name: Classic Movies From American Literature Quiz | Movies | 10 Questions

questions.text: Henry Fonda starred as Tom Joad in the movie version of John Steinbeck's 'The Grapes of Wrath'. Who played Ma Joad?
questions.explanation:
Jane Darwell.

	Darwell also starred with Fonda in 'The Ox-Bow Incident'. Both movies were quite good.

questions.text: What actor starred in the movie version of Stephen Crane's 'The Red Badge of Courage'?
questions.explanation:
Audie Murphy.

	A war hero in a movie about combat. Makes sense.

questions.text: Gary Cooper starred in the movie version of Ernest Hemingway's 'For Whom The Bell Tolls'. Who played the female lead?
questions.explanation:
Ingrid Bergman.

	Cooper also did a version of 'A Farewell to Arms', as did Rock Hudson.

questions.text: Which actor starred in Sinclair Lewis' 'Dodsworth'?
questions.explanation:
Walter Huston.

	He's best remembered for his roles when he was older, but once upon a time ...

questions.text: There have been many versions of James Fenimore Cooper's 'Last of the Mohicans'. Which of the following actors starred as Hawkeye?
questions.explanation:
Randolph Scott.

	Scott starred in a version that was made in the 30's. Daniel Day-Lewis did the role much later.

questions.text: A movie version was made of the classic novel, 'The Bridge of San Luis Rey'. Who was the author of the novel?
questions.explanation:
Thornton Wilder.

	No big names in the cast. Melville had movie versions made of 'Billy Budd' and 'Moby {Dick';} Hawthorne had movie versions made of 'The Scarlet Letter'.

questions.text: ''The Heiress' was a fine movie starring Olivia DeHavilland and Montgomery Clift. It was an adaptation of a novel by what author?
'A Place in the Sun' was a fine movie with Montgomery Clift and Elizabeth Taylor. It was an adaptation of a novel; who was the novel's author?
'The Call of the Wild' was a fine adaptation of Jack London's novel of the same name. Clark Gable was the male star; who was the female lead?
questions.explanation:
Loretta Young.

	Entertaining. (The dog was named Buck.)
